column1: Recursively Learning Causal Structures Using Regression-Based Conditional Independence Test
AAAI Technical Track: Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
This paper addresses two important issues in causality inference. One is how to reduce redundant conditional independence (CI) tests
column2: which heavily impact the efficiency and accuracy of existing constraint-based methods. Another is how to construct the true causal graph from a set of Markov equivalence classes returned by these methods.
